title: Nadine Coyle 'signs up' for new series of I'm A Celebrity
text:
Nadine Coyle is hotly tipped to appear on I’m A Celebrity (Picture: C Brandon/Redferns)

Nadine Coyle has reportedly signed up for the new series of I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here.

The former Girls Aloud star is the latest celebrity hotly tipped to be headed into camp and show bosses are allegedly thrilled to have her on board – hoping she’ll spill all on her old bandmates, including Cheryl and Kimberley Walsh.

According to The Sun, Nadine, who recently split from her long-term partner and baby daddy Jason Bell, is hoping that a stint in the jungle will help to kickstart her career again.

A source claims: ‘Nadine is a big name and ITV was keen to get her. It’s no secret there’s no love lost between [Nadine and Cheryl] and Nadine is refreshingly honest about what went on [in Girls Aloud] from her perspective.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I’m A Celebrity could well be the start of something big for her again.’

Show bosses are hoping Nadine will talk about her time in Girls Aloud in camp (Picture: Getty Images)

Nadine has previously spoken of her relationship with her Girls Alound bandmates (Cheryl, Kimberley, Nicola Roberts and Sarah Harding} and previously claimed there was ‘no friendship’ between the girls.

Although, Kimberley had hit back at that, insisting Nadine’s claims ‘simply were not true’.

Girls Aloud was formed on talent show Popstars: The Rivals back in 2002 and they split just over a decade later, with Kimberely claiming back in July that the band won’t be having a reunion at all.

Ant will present I’m A Celeb with Dec this year (Picture: ITV)

Nadine, meanwhile, is set to join the likes of Jamie Laing, Coronation Street star Lucy Fallon and Love Island’s Maura Higgins in the jungle – if this year’s camp rumours turn out to be true.

Metro.co..uk has reached out to reps for Nadine and ITV.

I’m A Celebrity is expected to return next month and will see Ant McPartlin back presenting alongside Declan Donnelly, after the TV presenter took a break away from the show last year.

Ant had taken an extended break from TV, following a stint in rehab and a drink drive conviction in 2018, and was replaced by Holly Willoughby.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: The former Girls Aloud star is hotly tipped to enter the I'm A Celebrity jungle in 2019.
